title: Chinese Government provides agricultural technology to the Burkina Faso Ministry of Agriculture in November 2021
description: On November 26, 2021, the Chinese Government provided agricultural technology materials to Burkina Faso’s Ministry of Agriculture. These materials will be used to improve the agricultural operations of the ministry. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.  A handover ceremony was held for this donation at the Burkina Faso Rice Center (PRP). Chinese Ambassador to Burkina Faso, Li Jian, and Secretary General of the Ministry of Agriculture of Burkina Faso, Yahia Sindo, attended the ceremony.
combined_text:
# Sector
AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY, FISHING

# Title
Chinese Government provides agricultural technology to the Burkina Faso Ministry of Agriculture in November 2021

# Description
On November 26, 2021, the Chinese Government provided agricultural technology materials to Burkina Faso’s Ministry of Agriculture. These materials will be used to improve the agricultural operations of the ministry. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.  A handover ceremony was held for this donation at the Burkina Faso Rice Center (PRP). Chinese Ambassador to Burkina Faso, Li Jian, and Secretary General of the Ministry of Agriculture of Burkina Faso, Yahia Sindo, attended the ceremony.
justification: Project focuses on agricultural technology transfer without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Agricultural technology materials, focus on improving agricultural operations

title: Chinese Government donates 500,000 Sinopharm Covid-19 vaccine doses worth $9 million in October 2021
description: On October 14, 2021, the Chinese Government delivered 500,000 Sinopharm Covid-19 vaccine doses to the Government of Burundi. The vaccine handover ceremony took place Thursday at the office of the Extended Vaccination Program in Mukaza district in the commercial capital Bujumbura. Chinese Ambassador to Burundi Zhao Jiangping and Burundian officials including Health Minister Thaddee Ndikumana attended the ceremony.
staff_comments: 1. According to the UNICEF COVID-19 Vaccine Market Dashboard, the price of a single Sinopharm COVID-19 vaccine dose is $18 (https://www.oecd.org/officialdocuments/publicdisplaydocumentpdf/?cote=DCD/DAC/STAT(2022)33&docLanguage=En). As such, AidData has estimated the monetary value of the October 2021 donation as $9 million.
combined_text:
# Sector
EMERGENCY RESPONSE

# Title
Chinese Government donates 500,000 Sinopharm Covid-19 vaccine doses worth $9 million in October 2021

# Description
On October 14, 2021, the Chinese Government delivered 500,000 Sinopharm Covid-19 vaccine doses to the Government of Burundi. The vaccine handover ceremony took place Thursday at the office of the Extended Vaccination Program in Mukaza district in the commercial capital Bujumbura. Chinese Ambassador to Burundi Zhao Jiangping and Burundian officials including Health Minister Thaddee Ndikumana attended the ceremony.
justification: Project is a healthcare donation with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of 500,000 Covid-19 vaccine doses, healthcare focus

title: China Eximbank suspends debt service payments from Government of Burundi in 2021
description: In response to the COVID-19 pandemic and the G20 Finance Ministers and Central Bank Governors meeting that took place on April 15, 2020 and on November 13, 2020, the Chinese Government agreed to work with other G20 members to implement the Debt Service Suspension Initiative (DSSI). Then, in 2021, China Eximbank and the Government of Burundi signed a debt suspension agreement. Under the terms of the agreement, the lender agreed to suspend interest payments due in 2021 under one or more loan agreements. The total estimated suspension amount was $384,000.   However, at the time that the parties signed the debt suspension agreement, they both acknowledged that the total suspension amount would ultimately be determined at the end of the suspension period (since loan disbursements could be made during the suspension period and the lender agreed to suspend the payment of interest accrued on any disbursements during the suspension period). The lender and borrower agreed that the suspension of debt service would be undertaken on a net present value (NPV)-neutral basis. Therefore, the borrower agreed to pay interest accrued on the amount outstanding under the total suspension amount (‘Suspension Interest’) by paying the Suspension Interest on the amount outstanding under each loan agreement’s suspension amount at the same rate of interest set forth in the original loan agreement.  Under the terms of the debt suspension agreement, the lender and the borrower also agreed that ‘[t]he suspension interest on the amount outstanding under the Suspension Amount concerning each Loan Agreement shall be calculated on the basis of the actual number of days elapsed and a year of 360 days, from and including the Repayment Date/Repayment Date of Principal and Interest falling within the Suspension Period to the date of payment in full of the corresponding Suspension Amount, and shall be paid in arrears on each Interest Payment Date under the corresponding Loan Agreement.’   The borrower also agreed that (1) ‘it shall continue to perform all its obligations […] under the Loan Agreements as supplemented and amended by [the debt suspension agreement]’; (2) ‘it shall use the created fiscal space to increase social, health, or economic spending in response to the COVID-19 crisis […]’ and ‘work closely with the International Financial Institutions who are expected to put in place a monitoring system’;  (3) ‘it shall disclose to the Lender all Public Sector Financial Commitments (as defined in the Government Finance Statistics Manual 2014 (GFSM2014)), respecting commercially sensitive information’; and (4) ‘it shall contract no new non-concessional debt during the Suspension Period, other than agreements under the DSSI’.
staff_comments: 1. AidData assumes that the same basic terms and conditions that governed China Eximbank’s DSSI (debt suspension) agreement with other governments also applied to its DSSI agreement that it signed with the Government of Burundi. Illustrative DSSI agreements can be accessed via https://www.dropbox.com/s/huwa695j3w9hwig/DSSI%20Agreement%20for%20Kyrgyz%20Republic.pdf?dl=0 and https://www.dropbox.com/s/67n1oq44it27kvu/3.%20Debt%20Suspension%20Agreement%20for%20GCL%20Other%20Projects.pdf?dl=0 and https://www.dropbox.com/s/n69i598f0fg7s80/6.%20Debt%20Suspension%20Agreement%20for%20PBC%20C2.pdf?dl=0.2. The total estimated suspension amount is based on the size of the debt service deferral that the Government of Burundi secured from the Chinese Government in 2021 (as recorded by the World Bank's Debtor Reporting System on December 6, 2022).
combined_text:
# Sector
ACTION RELATING TO DEBT

# Title
China Eximbank suspends debt service payments from Government of Burundi in 2021

# Description
In response to the COVID-19 pandemic and the G20 Finance Ministers and Central Bank Governors meeting that took place on April 15, 2020 and on November 13, 2020, the Chinese Government agreed to work with other G20 members to implement the Debt Service Suspension Initiative (DSSI). Then, in 2021, China Eximbank and the Government of Burundi signed a debt suspension agreement. Under the terms of the agreement, the lender agreed to suspend interest payments due in 2021 under one or more loan agreements. The total estimated suspension amount was $384,000.   However, at the time that the parties signed the debt suspension agreement, they both acknowledged that the total suspension amount would ultimately be determined at the end of the suspension period (since loan disbursements could be made during the suspension period and the lender agreed to suspend the payment of interest accrued on any disbursements during the suspension period). The lender and borrower agreed that the suspension of debt service would be undertaken on a net present value (NPV)-neutral basis. Therefore, the borrower agreed to pay interest accrued on the amount outstanding under the total suspension amount (‘Suspension Interest’) by paying the Suspension Interest on the amount outstanding under each loan agreement’s suspension amount at the same rate of interest set forth in the original loan agreement.  Under the terms of the debt suspension agreement, the lender and the borrower also agreed that ‘[t]he suspension interest on the amount outstanding under the Suspension Amount concerning each Loan Agreement shall be calculated on the basis of the actual number of days elapsed and a year of 360 days, from and including the Repayment Date/Repayment Date of Principal and Interest falling within the Suspension Period to the date of payment in full of the corresponding Suspension Amount, and shall be paid in arrears on each Interest Payment Date under the corresponding Loan Agreement.’   The borrower also agreed that (1) ‘it shall continue to perform all its obligations […] under the Loan Agreements as supplemented and amended by [the debt suspension agreement]’; (2) ‘it shall use the created fiscal space to increase social, health, or economic spending in response to the COVID-19 crisis […]’ and ‘work closely with the International Financial Institutions who are expected to put in place a monitoring system’;  (3) ‘it shall disclose to the Lender all Public Sector Financial Commitments (as defined in the Government Finance Statistics Manual 2014 (GFSM2014)), respecting commercially sensitive information’; and (4) ‘it shall contract no new non-concessional debt during the Suspension Period, other than agreements under the DSSI’.
justification: Project involves debt service suspension and financial arrangements without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Debt suspension agreement, focus on financial obligations and COVID-19 response spending

title: Chinese Embassy provides 'Ambassador Scholarship' to impoverished students at the University of Burundi in July 2021
description: On July 20, 2021, the Chinese Embassy provided scholarships to impoverished students at the University of Burundi. Zhao Jiangping, the Chinese Ambassador to Burundi, attended the signing ceremony along with the president of the University of Burundi, and Zhou Hong, the Chinese Director of the Confucius Institute at the University of Burundi.   This was the fourth annual implementation of the scholarship. The purpose of the scholarship is to provide financial aid to impoverished students. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
Chinese Embassy provides 'Ambassador Scholarship' to impoverished students at the University of Burundi in July 2021

# Description
On July 20, 2021, the Chinese Embassy provided scholarships to impoverished students at the University of Burundi. Zhao Jiangping, the Chinese Ambassador to Burundi, attended the signing ceremony along with the president of the University of Burundi, and Zhou Hong, the Chinese Director of the Confucius Institute at the University of Burundi.   This was the fourth annual implementation of the scholarship. The purpose of the scholarship is to provide financial aid to impoverished students. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.
justification: Scholarship program focused on education and poverty alleviation without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Scholarships for impoverished students, education sector focus, no energy-related components

title: Chinese Embassy in Burundi provides air conditioners to the government of Bujumbura, Burundi
description: On February 12, 2021, the Chinese Embassy provided air conditioners to the Government of Bujumbura, the economic capital of Burundi. This donation was made for use in the offices of the Bujumbura municipal government. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.  A handover ceremony was held for this donation. Chargé d'Affaires Wang Yuan and Director of the General Office of Bujumbura City Government Jean Bosco Barege attended the ceremony.

title: Chinese Embassy in Burundi provides materials to the First Lady of Burundi’s 'Bonne Action' fund to support women's work and education
description: On March 5, 2021, the Chinese Embassy provided miscellaneous supplies to the First Lady of Burundi’s “Bonne Action” fund. The materials included computers, sewing machines, school bags and other materials. The purpose of this donation is to support the work and education of women in Burundi. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.   A handover ceremony was held for this donation. The Chargé d'affaires ad interim of the Chinese Embassy in Burundi, Wang Yuan, First Lady Angelina, and other members of the foundation attended the ceremony.
staff_comments: 1. Alternative names for the 'Bonne Action' Fund include 'Good Deeds' and '善行'
combined_text:

title: Chinese medical teams provide 15 tons of medical equipment to hospitals in Bujumbura, Burundi
description: On June 7, 2021, three Chinese medical teams in Burundi donated almost 15 tons of medicine and medical equipment to be distributed to residents and hospitals of Bujumbura, Burundi. The three teams were Bujumbura Medical Point, Mubanda Medical Point, and Gitega Medical Point. The materials included clinical drugs, protective masks, and surgical medical devices. The supplies were then distributed within a week of their delivery on June 7, 2021. The purpose of this donation is to support Burundi’s COVID-19 response efforts. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.   A handover ceremony was held for this donation. The captains of the three medical teams and directors of the recipient hospitals attended the ceremony.
combined_text:

evidence: Donation of medical equipment and supplies for COVID-19 response, healthcare focus

title: Chinese Embassy provides anti-epidemic materials to the Burundi Ministry of Public Health and AIDS Prevention and Control in July 2021
description: On July 27, 2021, the Chinese Embassy in Burundi donated anti-epidemic medical materials to the Burundi Ministry of Public Health and AIDS Prevention and Control. The materials included ventilators and other miscellaneous medical supplies. This was the 8th batch of materials donated by China to fight COVID-19 in Burundi. It was distributed to hospitals including the Grand Prince Hospital. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.   A handover ceremony was held for this donation. Ambassador Zhao Jiangping, Assistant Minister of Public Health Nzigi Rabamia, Economic and Commercial Counselor Xiao Guofeng, President of the Grand Prince Hospital Oscar, and members of the 20th Chinese medical team to Burundi attended the ceremony. During the ceremony, Ambassador Zhao and Assistant Nzigi Rabamia signed the donation certificate.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Chinese Embassy provides anti-epidemic materials to the Burundi Ministry of Public Health and AIDS Prevention and Control in July 2021

# Description
On July 27, 2021, the Chinese Embassy in Burundi donated anti-epidemic medical materials to the Burundi Ministry of Public Health and AIDS Prevention and Control. The materials included ventilators and other miscellaneous medical supplies. This was the 8th batch of materials donated by China to fight COVID-19 in Burundi. It was distributed to hospitals including the Grand Prince Hospital. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.   A handover ceremony was held for this donation. Ambassador Zhao Jiangping, Assistant Minister of Public Health Nzigi Rabamia, Economic and Commercial Counselor Xiao Guofeng, President of the Grand Prince Hospital Oscar, and members of the 20th Chinese medical team to Burundi attended the ceremony. During the ceremony, Ambassador Zhao and Assistant Nzigi Rabamia signed the donation certificate.
justification: Project involves donation of medical supplies for public health purposes with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of anti-epidemic medical materials including ventilators, focus on healthcare and COVID-19 response

title: Chinese Embassy provides aid materials to Kamonge Technical School in Burundi in August 2021
description: On August 18, 2021, the Chinese Embassy in Burundi donated unspecified aid materials to the Kamonge Technical School, a secondary school in Burundi. The embassy reported that the purpose of the donation was to improve the school's hardware level and students' learning conditions. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.  A handover ceremony took place for this donation. Zhao Jiangping, the Chinese Ambassador to Burundi, and Enzi Tongda, the principal of Kamonge Technical School, attended the ceremony.

title: Chinese Embassy provides 122 sets of desks and chairs to Keningya Primary School in Burundi
description: On November 4, 2021, the Chinese Embassy donated 122 sets of desks and chairs to Keningya Primary School in Burundi. The school is located in Gatumba County in the Bujumbura Agricultural Province of Burundi. The purpose of the donation was to improve the educational environment for students in Burundi and support their overall educational development goals. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.   A handover ceremony was held for this donation. The Chinese ​​Political Counselor Wang Yuan, and  representatives of UNICEF in Bujumbura, Bujumbura Agricultural Provincial Government, and the Ministry of National Education and Research attended the ceremony.
